abstract: A big mystery seller of futures contracts during the market meltdown last week was not a hedge fund or a high-frequency trader as many have suspected, but the money manager Waddell & Reed Financial, according to a document obtained by Reuters.
snippet: A big mystery seller of futures contracts during the market meltdown last week was not a hedge fund or a high-frequency trader as many have suspected, but the money manager Waddell & Reed Financial, according to a document obtained by Reuters.
lead_paragraph: 6:58 p.m. | Updated The New York Times’s Nelson D. Schwartz provides more details about Waddell & Reed’s role in the market plunge.

headline.main: Waddell Named as Mystery Trader in Market Plunge
